alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Bossier; Red River; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 7:04PM CST until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas...Louisiana... Bayou Dorcheat Near Springhill affecting Columbia and Webster Parishes. Bayou Dorcheat At Dixie Inn affecting Webster, Bossier and Bienville Parishes. Bayou Dorcheat At Lake Bistineau affecting Webster, Bossier, Red River and Bienville Parishes. For the Bayou Dorcheat...including Springhill, Dixie Inn, Lake Bistineau...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bayou Dorcheat at Lake Bistineau. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 143.0 feet, Water begins to flow over Louisiana 164. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 141.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 141.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 143.5 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 142.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 143.5 feet on 01/03/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 715 PM CST.
